data.title: Book Excerpts
data.text:
Soul Masters: The Hunting Grounds by K.R. Gastreich

Fantasy Romance Science Fiction

Passions Ignite in Atmospheric Supernatural Romance. A fun supernatural read with a smoldering romance, perfect for readers to take with them into the chilling fall days ahead.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

The Empowerment to Conquer Illnesses by Mireille Mandat

Better Self Nonfiction Self Help

Woman’s Journey Provides Helpful Guide to Healing from Chronic Pain. Anyone who has or knows someone who has one of those “invisible” illnesses like fibromyalgia needs to read this book.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Childless Mother: A Search for Son and Self by Tracy Mayo

Memoir

A Mother’s Quest to Find Herself and Her Lost Son. Emotional, heartbreaking, poignant, introspective, and hopeful all at the same time.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Cold War: A Novel of the Berlin Airlift by Helena P. Schrader

Fiction Historical Fiction

Insightful and Exciting Military Thriller Leaves Readers Hungry For More. Schrader is well on her way to writing the “War and Peace” of the Berlin Airlift.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Healing Burnout with Astrology & Tarot by Jackie Hope

Better Self Nonfiction Self Help

Transform Burnout into Fuel and Ignite Your Desired Path. This book could very well be the light you need to set you back on your true path.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Maypole Man: A Novel of the Sixties by Carol Egmont St. John

Historical Fiction

In 1960s America, The Disillusioned Search for Truth. Maypole Man: A Novel of the Sixties; is a glimpse at a group of young adults who face artistic, philosophical and social questions of the same ilk that challenged many other generations.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Crude by Mike Bond

Fiction Thrillers

Doomsday Clock Is Set in Explosive Political Thriller. After his company’s oil platform explodes, Ross Bullock worries powerful political forces are trying to shut him down for his open concerns about the threat of nuclear war. So he puts together a team of specialists to fight back before it’s too late.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Heart of Grit by Shelli Sivert

Action and Adventure Historical Fiction Young Adult

Adventure with the Pony Express in YA Western. It's 1860 on the American frontier. Talk of a civil war is brewing, and the Pony Express is born and in need of riders. Both in disguise, Bea and Charlie venture out into a world filled with injustice and corruption. It's going to take drastic action and a heart of grit to save everything they hold dear.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Crash Course: A Founder's Journey to Saving Your Startup and Sanity by Ricardo Jiménez

Nonfiction

Instructing Aspiring Entrepreneurs on What NOT to Do. An unsuccessful attempt at entrepreneurship opens the door for an aspiring CEO to view success through the eyes of failure.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Hard Bargain by Donald G. Denihan with Jon Land

Biography Memoir

Near-Death Experiences Provide Author a New Lease on Life. For Donald Denihan, it was supposed to be the fishing trip of a lifetime. Instead, it ended up nearly costing him his life in a hard bargain he made with the sea. Near death experiences were nothing new to this successful real estate entrepreneur, though.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Orb and Arrow by V.L. Stuart

Fantasy

Discover Magic and Adventure in Evocative Epic Fantasy. Brillar was expected to follow in her mother's footsteps and become a healer but she had other plans. Now a highly skilled archer, she has been forced to kill to release a bound mage.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

The Last Tale of Norah Bow by J.P. White

Fiction Historical Fiction

Girl’s Search for Abducted Father in Prohibition-Era Coming-of-Age. In 1926, during Prohibition, when Vital Bow is abducted at gunpoint during dinner at his family cottage, his intrepid fourteen-year-old daughter discovers his involvement in a rum-running operation and sails north to rescue him.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Wolf’s Head Bay (Book 2): The Race for Home by Jeffrey Allen Boyd

Action and Adventure Young Adult

Action-Packed Thriller Sequel Is Rollercoaster of Suspense and Intrigue. After making their harrowing escape, taking with them a stolen flash drive of incriminating evidence, the frightened group now finds themselves alone in the remote northern Michigan wilderness.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

What We Buried by Robert Rotenberg

Historical Fiction Mystery Suspense Thrillers

Unsolved Murders, Family Secrets and Dark History of Nazi-Occupied Italy. A Toronto homicide detective is attacked at his doorstep when his investigation into possible links between the Nazi occupation of Italy and the murder of his brother decades later gets too close to the truth.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

The Need-Not Artist by Kasha Ritter

Memoir Nonfiction

Practical and Inspirational Guide Helps Artists Foster Creativity. A devoted mother of three with a bustling household shares her personal story of pursuing her artistic passion amid the chaos of daily life, dismantling common excuses and providing step-by-step guidance on overcoming obstacles such as housework or daily demands, children, and perceived lack of talent.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Going Crazy (Left Foot, Right Foot, Breathe) by Tim James

Memoir Self Help

Perseverance and Integrity Behind the Scenes of the Music Industry. Going Crazy (Left Foot, Right Foot, Breathe) is a candid look at the inner workings of professional songwriting. It is also an honest, vulnerable memoir about overcoming life's trials and tribulations.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Guilty of Stealing His Heart by Nancy Lynn White

Fiction Historical Fiction Romance

Woman on the Run Finds New Love and Family in Western Romance. An unsuspecting bride implicated in her husband’s wrongdoings finds new love and family in the American West of 1860.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Volk by D. Werkmeister

Crime Paranormal Suspense Thrillers

Supernatural Intrigue Meets Real-World Grit in the Heart of Philadelphia. Something is out there, stalking the streets of Philadelphia. When FBI agent Terri Watson comes face to face with the beast, she discovers an explosive secret — one that powerful men will kill to keep hidden.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Abandoned at Birth by Janet Sherlund

Memoir Nonfiction

Gripping Memoir About Adoptee’s Lifelong Search for Identity and Connection. Sherlund, who was given up for adoption within days of her birth, shares her journey and explores the inherent need adopted children have for a sense of belonging and the pain and courage that is required to discover their true identity.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Fire in the Hole! by Bob Parsons

Business Memoir

From Baltimore to Billionaire: GoDaddy Founder Shares Inspiring Journey. In Fire in the Hole!, Bob Parsons, founder of GoDaddy, shares his story of extraordinary success as a self-made serial entrepreneur.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Leaning on Air by Cheryl Bostrom

Fiction

Lyrical Tale of Love and Redemption Paints Portrait of Pacific Northwest. They last spoke as teens … but a surprise encounter 12 years later reunites ornithologist Celia Burke with veterinary surgeon Burnaby Hayes, and they plunge into the most unusual romance of her life. When tragedy strikes, Celia begins anew, and she must examine her past ― and reconsider her future.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Seven Days of SHIVA by Marc Gellman

Memoir Nonfiction

Unforgettable Story About the Power of Love Through the Eyes of the Man Who Lived It. After losing his wife of 40 years, the author uses the seven days of Shiva to tell family and friends their love story.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Deaf Blind Champion by Kevin Frost

Biography Memoir Nonfiction

Blind, Deaf Athlete’s Inspiring Story of Hope and Excellence in Sports and Life. A world champion speed skater despite the obstacles of being deaf and blind, this athlete reflects on his bumpy yet fantastic ride — on the field and in life.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Freeing Teresa by Franke James

Biography Memoir Nonfiction

Memoir Recounts Sister’s Rescue Mission and the Ongoing Fight For Disability Justice. When an idealistic activist objects to her siblings’ plan to ship their disabled sister off to a nursing home, she’s forced to choose between family and her sister’s freedom.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Musings 2022 by Denis O'Neill

Nonfiction

Sweeping Essay Collection Muses on the Tumultuous Times of 2022. 2022 was a year of living most dangerously. The pandemic marched on, Putin marched in, and the GOP marched deeper into MAGA madness. In “Musings 2022,” author/screenwriter/observer Denis O'Neill describes a world most unsettled in a collection of essays about politics, people, poetry and a few things Irish.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Fail Deadly by John Baird Rogers

Fiction Thrillers

Dynamic Duo Save the Day from Cyber Terrorism in Futuristic Thriller. The grid is failing, the ransom demand is a billion dollars, and the only person who can save them has disappeared. In the latest Mayfield-Napolitani Thriller, can Joe and Weezy save the day — or will they end up getting themselves killed?

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Be a Scribe! by Michael Hoffen, Dr. Christian Casey and Dr. Jen Thum

Children’s Books Historical Nonfiction

Teenager Brings Ancient Egypt to Life in Timeless Translated Story of Family and Career. This extraordinary ancient Egyptian translation from almost 4,000 years ago tells the story of a teenage boy as he wonders what career path he should choose.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

The Grip of Darkness: Divinity by Kristoff Baggan

Fantasy Fiction Science Fiction

Sweeping Novel Strikes Balance Between the Fantastical and the Profoundly Human. This novel is a must-read for fans of fantasy and those who appreciate stories that challenge and provoke critical thought.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Once Upon Tomorrow by Shurick Agapitov

Action and Adventure Young Adult

Tech Founder Unveils the Future of the Metaverse in Thought-Provoking New Book. Once Upon Tomorrow unpacks the sometimes vague concept of the metaverse and shares the opportunities that are and will be available within this new world.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Obesity by Richard Fast

Nonfiction Self Help

Wellness Coach’s Unique Perspective on Health and Obesity. Despite what we’ve been told, obesity is not a weight issue, it’s a health issue, and it’s resulting in the greatest health crises we’ve ever faced. “Obesity” examines the culprit, the cause, and the cure of this global epidemic.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Fixing America by William M. Taggart IV

Nonfiction

Top Engineer Assesses the Damage of American Politics, Economics and Society — & How to Fix It.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Between the Heart and the Shadows by Rowena Tisdale

Fiction

Heartbreaking Journey of Broken Promises, Infidelity and Desperation. Claire is living happily ever after with Aaron, her devoted, younger husband, until an unforeseen tragedy threatens their idyllic life.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Built to Finish: How to Go the Distance in Business and in Life by Steven Pivnik

Business Nonfiction

Entrepreneur and Endurance Athlete’s Lessons for Success in Business and Life. An endurance athlete’s formula for success for entrepreneurs: the grit to start, the stamina to finish, and the balance to live fully along the way.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

My Father's Story by Eric Johnson

Crime Memoir Nonfiction

Son’s Harrowing Account of Trial of His Father’s Killer in True Crime Memoir. Discover the captivating story of the life and tragic death of Bill Johnson, who was brutally murdered by his ex-girlfriend in his own home, as his son breaks down every detail of the trial.

Read Review

Download Excerpt

Teaching in the Dark by Genét Simone

Biography Memoir Nonfiction

Riveting Memoir Reveals Lifetime of Lessons from Teacher’s Time in Remote Alaskan Village. In a remote Alaskan village, a young teacher relies on her courage, resilience and wit while enduring freezing temperatures, power outages, loneliness, and first-year teacher anxieties and missteps, but eventually realizes that those challenges pale in comparison to the life lessons she learns about the heart of teaching.

Read Review

Download Excerpt
